title: Domain 1.3: Explain the importance of change management processes and the impact to security.
content:
🏢 Business Processes

  • Approval Process: Changes must be reviewed and authorized before implementation.
  • Ownership: Assigns accountability to a responsible person for oversight.
  • Stakeholders: Includes all impacted groups to evaluate risks and requirements.
  • Impact Analysis: Examines the effects of changes on business, security, and operations.
  • Test Results: Validates success and security in a test environment before go-live.
  • Backout Plan: A defined rollback procedure if a change causes issues.
  • Maintenance Window: Schedules changes during low-impact times to avoid disruptions.
  • Standard Operating Procedure (SOP): Documents repeatable, secure implementation steps.

🛠️ Technical Implications

  • Allow Lists / Deny Lists: Defines permitted or blocked applications/services.
  • Restricted Activities: Limits user/system actions to reduce potential threats.
  • Downtime: Change may require scheduled outages, impacting availability.
  • Service Restart: Needed to apply changes—may interrupt live systems temporarily.
  • Application Restart: Reboots applications, possibly disrupting users.
  • Legacy Applications: May break with modern changes or lack support for updates.
  • Dependencies: Recognizing connected systems prevents cascading issues.

📄 Documentation

  • Updating Diagrams: Keeps network/system maps accurate for reference and audits.
  • Updating Policies/Procedures: Ensures documentation reflects current practices and requirements.

🗂️ Version Control

  • Tracks and manages changes to files, code, and documentation.
  • Supports collaboration, auditing, and rollback capabilities.
